thread.title: Man charged with homicide in disabled son's death
thread.title_full: Man charged with homicide in disabled son's death | www.statesman.com

title: Man charged with homicide in disabled son's death
text:
A Lancaster man is charged with homicide by child abuse in connection to the Sept. 4 death of his son.
The Lancaster Sheriffâ€™s Office said Robert Jordan told them that the child, who had a disability, fell out of his wheelchair and hit his head on the floor on the morning of Sept. 4.
Jordan, 47, drove the child to Springs Memorial Hospital. The child was flown to Carolinas Medical Center where he died the same day.
>> Read more trending stories
An autopsy determined the child died from blunt force injury to his head.
Investigators interviewed witnesses who knew the Jordan family and reviewed the autopsy report. They took Jordan into custody on Tuesday.
Lancaster man charged with homicide in disabled son's Sept. 4 death
